review:
Fun game I got as a gift from Fluffy, oh the irony which you'll understand if you play the game.

Anyways. Unlike standard RPG's, you're actually fighting in the aftermath of the end of the world after losing to the last boss. As you go through the story albeit rather short, you'll realize the heroes are kind of a-holes, and at times the game is much harder than it had to be.

It has a unique "hero call" system which i've never really seen in an RPG before where-as rather than playing as the heroes themselves, you're playing those side "npc" characters you're al so familiar with, and they let you summon a hero to use certain skills.

Game is roughly four to six hours long, but I attempted to do some extra stuff and got lazy so my gameplay is a bit longer. You have to get x number of points to unlock the final post end game stuff, but the effort involved doesn't really excite me to do so. The game in itself is fun, has an ending that was more or less predictable, but all the characters had personality and makes me hope they make a prequel of the game to develop the characters back stories more. That's probably just me being hopeful though.

For the price while it's on sale, it's a great unique little RPG worth picking up if you're into that kind of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017196792', 'num_games_owned': 3699, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1450662296}
review:
Oh! RPG! is an RPG maker game of upper quality , which is rather rare in this ocean of RPG Maker games available. The music is really good. The graphics - or rather the choice of tile sets used - are very cute, colorful, crisp and clean.

Where the game truly shines is in the gameplay - or more precisely WHO you play. You don't play the heroes - who are mainly selfish brats anyway - but the background-second-roles-NPCs you generally meet in these types of games: for example in the first chapter you play a goblin; in the third one an old lady! Telling you more about these characters would be huge spoilers but just know that even though they're very limited and one dimensional, they're very endearing with their reckless bravery. All want to stand and fight for different reasons. I'm amazed a small RPG maker game managed to make those tiny characters so interesting, funny and attaching.

About the combats, those characters are indeed weak but fear not, you'll be able to call the 'heroes' for help - if they do indulge to respond lol! For this part you'll have to juggle with a very limited number of loot (healing potions included) and a limited number of heroes calls. At first the learning curve is a bit stiff but you'll be satisfied as your NPC characters will slowly grow stronger and be able to fight on their own. You'll also find equipement and upgrades but be careful as the upgrades parts are very limited. So what I first thought out to be a casual RPG game turned out to be very interesting, rather challenging and kept me on the edge of my seat. i.e. nothing more satifying than managing to take out 3 huge rats all on your own when you play a tiny weak goblin!

The story is divided in 8 chapters, 3 (IIRC) of them are only a small narrative sequence. The 5 playable chapters are quite long, requiring an hour each. The story have all the usual classic dramatic clichés from J-RPGs: Evil Emperor taking over the world, world which is 'dying' and slowly collapsing etc. But it's sprinkled with a ton of humor: funny item descriptions, heroes with an attitude, funny dialogues, small details everywhere... I really liked it! It's a perfect balance for a second degree narration: a spoof of RPGs with a challenging gameplay.

You can replay any chapters whenever you want to make better scores to unlock a couple of stuff - like heroes to cast during combats. Some chapters features mazes so you'll have to be patient and cautious. There's a zone with puzzles. There's also some achievements to make and secrets to find and you'll have to replay the previous chapters to unlock all the secrets..  So the gameplay never gets dull. And you can play with your XBox Controller (very important point to me). Be warned that the game gets very hard toward the end but this makes winning the game even sweeter! My Playthrough lasted 9 hours and I still have a couple of achievements to make that should add a couple of hours (at least), so the game length is very decent.

The game quickly grows on you and it's hard to put down - you want to see what comes next. Really, this game is a small gem... Don't miss it!

I didn't fully finish the game but I was already forcing myself to continue for the past two stages so I decided I was done.

CUIDADO SPOILER, SI NO HAS JUGADO, NO LO LEAS A PARTIR DE: POQEWQ



He de decir, que el juego ha sido extraordinario, me ha dado sus horas y sus peleas, que por cierto, algunas son muy tentadas a la suerte, ya sabes a que me refiero, si has jugado.

Recomiendo el juego en su totalidad, pero recomiendo ser algo experimentado en los RPG.

POQEWQ

Mi valoración por ahora es de 

6,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198127605984', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1450143859}
review:
I don't do reviews for most of the games I play on Steam. But some games are just too special NOT to give an opinion on.

OH! RPG! is a 'launch' title for the newly released RPGMaker MV. Because MV is new (at the time the game came out) the graphics, sound, music, etc, are fresh and the dev put a lot of effort into making it professional.

This isn't your typical RPGMaker game. This isn't a cash grab done in 10 hours and released with no care. 

As I said, the dev put in a lot of work. The maps are full of life but nothing is wasted. The paths in the dungeons are never so conviluted that you get lost. The story is top notch. You can beat the game in less than 5 hours but the 'Heroes' are complex, the NPCs that you control are quirky in the right ways, and even the actual NPCs are more deep than "welcome to our city". 

The battle system is great. This is no button masher, where you just hit attack until the enemy dies. Each chapter's character has their own moveset that MUST be used with strategy in order to get by. The bosses especially must be defeated by thought, not by brute force.

The Devs on this project are very friendly, take a look at the discussion forum for OH! RPG! and you will see they are active and willing to talk about bugs, story, suggestions for additions, or anything else you wish to shoot the breeze about. This is a quality I can't value enough. Many devs forget the player exists once their money has been spent.

Weakpoints? As mentioned before, you can and prob will beat this game in less than 5 hours. So, take this game for what it is. It is a short but extremely fun RPG with replay value as you have a score for each chapter that you can go back and raise any time you wish.

review:
Old-school RPG fan ? If you are reading this, you are one of this kind ! (I hope somebody will read this at least)

OH! RPG! is what you say when you see the game for the first time in the store : you just add an article before "RPG", so that makes OH A RPG ! And then you see the graphics, and you say OH THAT'S LIKE THE OLD GAMES I USED TO PLAY AND EMULATE. After this, you take a look at the global evaluation and you see that it is good, like really positive. You take a look at its price, and you say OH IT'S NOT EXPENSIVE and you buy it, obviously.

The game narration is good, not boring, not too long. You dive into a classic but solid universe, and you dive in headfirst. Music and colors are really nice, that's a huge plus for this game, which is not only "another RPG" : Charming, you will like -or maybe not- the concept of comedy playlet, that has been pushed to the limit by cutting the game in several "episodes". They are following each others, but this is a point of view that I liked a lot. It reminded be the excellent and beautiful Saga Frontier 2 that I loved so much when I was a kid.

I haven't played a lot, but definitly recommand you this game, if you like the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962064956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1450911586}
review:
This is an updated review after enough of the bugs were patched for me to play the game relatively comfortably.

Probably one of the first games made with RPG Maker MV released on Steam, Oh! RPG! is an enjoyable game with an interesting prospect: to see what happens when the heroes lose, and how the "background characters", or "NPCs", live through it.

Story: interesting, funny at time, although rather conventional overall. The characters are not one-dimensional, without having particularly deep personalities either. They mostly shine thanks to the unusual focus the game offers. I found the ending to be particularly underwhelming, and was disappointed when I discovered that there is no "true" or "alternate" ending to be found in the current game, but that it might instead come as a DLC.

Gameplay: there are clear efforts made in order to offer an interesting and challenging gameplay, by letting you adjust difficulty for yourself by calling or not the heroes to assist you, and by giving key encounters puzzly twists. Most times, it works, sometimes, it does not.
The last chapter of the game is where it all comes crashing down, for the most part, because of RNG.
In one particular encounter, you are expected to debuff your massively overpowered oponent in order to survive their attacks. Unfortunately, you have no control on what he uses against you, and when, and he also tends to act before you. The result? If you are unlucky, the fight is over before you could take even one single action, and the odds are high enough that it can happen several times in a row.

Performance: abysmal.
The game lags on more than one occasion, starting with the title screen itself! There are also loading times lasting between 3 to 5 seconds between maps, although it only started to occur for me past the first stage. Other than that, a few frustrating bugs, including crashes and lockdowns, happened a few times while I was playing, but the last update seems to have fixed that. However, the lag and loading time issues remain.
The fault most likely lies in large parts on RPG Maker MV's engine itself, which seems poorly optimized and capricious in general. That's why I don't hold the peformance issues against the game like I would if the developers had a hand in the engine. RPG Maker MV is supposed to allow one to create games without having to tinker with the engine itself, therefore, while those performances issues are unacceptable, I lay the blame on Kadokawa, not RosePortal Games.

Now that the most critical issues have been patched, I do recommend this game, especially considering its low price, but be warned of the performance issues, and odd balancing which is the result of mixing together puzzle-combat and RNG without the ability to grind nor the consessions on difficulty you usually see in JRPGs.

Интересное начало игры, это мой первый раз когда со старта мне необходимо после каждого боя восстанавливать XP. Обычно в подобных играх идет долгая подготовка игрока к сложным боям, а начало проходится на одном дыхании, тут немного иначе - битвы несложные, но XP летит быстро.... что же будет дальше?
А дальше было вот, что раскачки персонажей нет, битвы с боссами сдаленны таким образом, что необходимо подбирать выигрышную тактику. Нельзя задавить босса получив более высокий лвл. Мобы не респятся, поэтому если кач и есть, то он минимальный и линейный - навязанный игрой. В общем меня лишили выбора и провели по игре как по натянутому канату, шаг влево или вправо карается.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037576203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1450150345}
review:
I regret reccomending this game. It honestly seemed like it was getting fixed, but the more I look at it, the more it seems like it was too broken to begin with.

The cover art is a lightly edited RPG maker wallpaper, the assets are unoriginal, the only thing that can't be done in vanilla RPG maker is the moving enemy sprites, which can be remedied with a 10 second google search.

It's supposed to be an RPG, right? As in Role Playing Game.

Well, the game is a old school final fantasy ARPG, but instead of managing several units, you only have one. And a slow loading bad. And that one unit is too weak to kill most tough monsters, with a few exceptions. So you wait for the screen nuke bar to fill, use that, boom. Done. In the overworld, you go through puzzles that consist of... find an item, use that item to beat thing that was otherwise impossible, move on. Or push button. Or shove block.

The Role Playing part isn't much better. You play as a few assorted NPC's, all of which are either default RPG Maker MV, or a custom character made with their sprite editor, but it doesn't really matter because they all have the same personality. Serious and grim. They have unique origin stories, but when it gets right down to it, it doesn't change the game.

There's an illusion of a bigger world going on, but we never see that bigger world. We never see the bigger picture. I'd prefer to play the lead up to the broken world than this, because then I'd get to see this illusiary would as it pretends to be- an epic quest with multiple unique locations. And I had reccomended this on the grounds that it would be fixed. It has not been, I rescend my reccomendation.

RPG maker is a tool for novice game designers to create something awesome. This... Is one good idea, turned into a dissappointing cash grab. I'm not going to give my seal of approval to this. It represents the Cube Worlds among us- An Indie game with a concept interesting enough to get people invested to buy it, then the creator leaves it an unfinished mess.

review:
What can I say about this game that isn’t in the description? Unique twist indeed! The legendary heroes have failed to stop the evil emperor, and now the whole world feels the aftermath of the end of the world. You play in this RPG maker JRPG style game as minor characters, bit players, even monsters, and chickens, playing out your tiny bit of drama in this setting.

I’ve played quite a few RPG maker titles, and OH! RPG! is a shining gem, worth double the price they are asking for it and one that shouldn’t be passed over. The artwork is spot on, scripting is ingenious, and game play that is executed very well. All in all, you know what you’re getting into when you step into the shoes of OH! RPG! Yet, it’s an enjoyable experience for certain. 

The ability to replay chapters adds another layer of depth and replayability, and for the price, I would not pass this one over if you’re looking for a JRPG. Note that I received a free copy of this game in exchange for my honest review. However that being said, the day I recieved the free copy, I had almost bought it anyways, and for the price, wouldn't have regretted that purchase at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238274952', 'num_games_owned': 1378, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1450098842}
review:
因为最近正好在摸索RPGMaker 所以看到这个游戏就索性买下来了 现在在一个多小时的游戏体验之后 不得不说这部游戏出乎我的意料。
当然出乎意料之处并不在于它将游戏性提升到了何种高度——OH!RPG!（以下简称OH）毕竟是一款基于RPG制作大师完成的游戏自然为其中诸多因素所掣肘，并不奇怪（然而就在这些代码与脚本之上却也搭建出了不俗、并且BUG少见的游戏，实在可贵）。
这款游戏真正令人意料之外在于它的剧情，没错，它的故事讲得有多么吸引人。与传统JRPG一贯“主角身负重任、打怪练级、遇见伙伴，搜集神装、挑战魔王”的剧情发展模式不同，OH将故事的开始设定在本应拯救世界的英雄一行人被魔王（Emperor）打败之后，整个故事基调继而笼罩在失意、崩坏、绝望的氛围之中，多亏魔王手下的一位微不足道的哥布林出手相救（至于为何要救他们不在此剧透），英雄一伙才得以逃出生天。这是故事的第一章，随之而来的章节便是分别以各种各样的人作为章节主角（类似pov手法），讲述他们在世界将被毁灭之时他们的绝望与挣扎，失败与伟大。这种与传统JRPG相悖的套路，在我看来，却恰恰奉行了JRPG的精神——剧情的推动。当我们对于走着康庄大道、一路披荆斩棘的勇者式叙事感到疲倦时，黑暗式的叙事风格却更撩人心弦。
而我相信仅仅只是好的剧情还不足以让我对OH赞誉有加；更叫人敬佩的是，在这款游戏中，所有游戏内部的设计，包括战斗系统，拾取系统，迷宫设计等,etc 不是为了衍生游戏性，却是为了把故事讲到极致。比如，因为英雄一行人挑战魔王业已失败，他们不再作为主角参与战斗，尽管他们从故事一开始便有象征最强的Lv.50；你能操控的不过是一个势单力薄的哥布林小弟，面对的却是拥有一般RPG游戏里最后一关实力水平的怪物（大多接近50级），你必须利用有限的能力，有限的资源，特别是妥当利用限制诸多的英雄召唤系统（英雄在本作里类似支援角色，通常能造成非常可观的伤害，但需要消耗数回合进行召唤，且不能频繁使用）来逃出生天；再比如，游戏第二章的主角是一个平凡的女村民，她必须通过复杂的隧道找到自己女儿，若让她在拿到合适的武器前去战斗基本不可能赢（我便是在这里栽了几次跟头），因此前期必须想方设法回避任何与怪物的战斗，直到取得武器为止。类似游戏系统为故事服务的例子不胜枚举，我如今仅仅不过玩了两章就有非常强烈的感觉，相信接下来会有更多惊喜。
将一款游戏所具有的所有资源全数花费在剧情之上，不得不说相当于赌博。但对于我来说，OH的制作者无疑是成功了，让人去玩RPG游戏很容易，但让人进入一款RPG游戏却很难。

author: {'steamid': '76561197983608283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1449934393}
review:
What would happen if the heroes of the story lose the final battle to save the world? what would people think about them? that's the premise of this story, with a little twist. Instead of controlling the heroes the main characters will be what you would call the "extras" in any other game. They will help the heroes return to their home to see the end of the world with their family and friends.

The game is divided into 8 chapters (although 3 of them are only cutscenes) and you will control 1 different character on each one. And like i said you will not control the heroes, but you can summon them on combat to help you with different skills.

On every chapter you will find a mix of exploration, combat, side quests and some puzzles (some of them are really tricky). Combat wise you will need to master the "call" function, knowing when to summon the heroes and for what. And at the end of each chapter you will get points depending on how you finished it, that will reward you with some perks to help you along the way.

I found the art really nice and like every game from RosePortal music is really good, specially the songs used in combat.

So in the end i can say that the game is really fun (also a little hard sometimes), and although the game is not long completing ranks, side quests and getting all achievements will take you a while. 

If you like RPG Maker games give it a try, for that price i don't think you're gonna lose much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071490039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1451135551}
review:
Disclaimer: I received a key from the developer for the purpose of beta testing. I have not been compelled to leave positive feedback and have judged this game by my own standards.

OH! RPG! comes from the same people who brought you Epic Quest of the 4 Crystals, and right off the bat, I will say that it's likely an improvement over said game. The intro at the start of the game made me feel this way almost instantly, and it isn't long before you are chucked right in at the deep end, straight into combat.

The music is improved here, and there's a great combination of guitar and a more traditional sound for the genre.

Graphics seem better too, especially environment graphics which are rather well detailed. Character graphics are probably a bit lacking, and the animation, at least in exploration mode, isn't a lot different from their previous effort. Combat mode is better, when it comes to character design, especially with enemy characters.

This game is still a sort of send up of JRPGs in general, or at least that's the feeling I get, as obvious references are made to Harry Potter and other franchises, but thankfully they seem to have left out a lot of the crude, sophomoric jokes this time. In fact dialogue as a whole seems to be less, at least initially (I have admittedly not spent a lot of time with it; it may get worse - or better depending on how you look at it - as you go along) and just limited to quick conversations which are good if you don't want your game constantly interrupted by long, drawn-out banter.

I found the game to be a bit harder than Epic Quest, even though there is a bit of hand holding going on as members of your party attempt to give you tips in combat. This is especially true because of the faster start with this game. There's no moving about and getting acquainted with things -- you are thrown right in and you have to learn the ropes on the fly. Don't expect any sort of training or a lull at the beginning here.

One thing I find that is much better is the interface. It doesn't have the same disjointed feel like with Epic Quest. You just press escape and you can access anything you want from the in game menu. That said, the interface, although it looks better, isn't very intuitive and it will take some experimenting and trial and error before you figure it out.

Overall, I would say this is as good if not a bit better than Epic Quest, but, and perhaps I am biased seeing as RPGs, especially JRPGs aren't really my thing, it's once again not a game that I would spend an inordinate amount of time playing. It's the same recipe as far as basic JRPG gameplay goes, but it seems more streamlined and polished than Epic Quest, so I think it's at least a step in the right direction.

review:
Aviso: Review realizada con una clave proporcionada por el editor. Review sincera sobre el juego.

Que decir tien que es obviamente un RPG hecho con el RPGMaker u otra herramienta similar como muchos otros juegos presentes en Steam.... Asi que porque decidirnos por este?
Pues por el planteamiento, historia y humor del mismo. En lugar de representar al grupo de heroes que salva al mundo, representas al grupo de amigos de losheroes que les ayudan tras haber fracasado estrepitosamente en su mision y nosolo no salvar al mundo sino condenarlo a su extinción. Porque si, en este juego los heroes han perdido y vuelven "con el rabo entre las piernas" a casa para pasar las ultima horas con sus seres queridos. 
El planteamiento es original y la forma de llevarlo a cabo tambien ya que los heroes solo participan en las batallas cuando solicitas su ayuda (y no siempre.... depende del "humor" del heroe, de "cansado que este" - si lo has utilizado muchas veces,  etc.)
El plantemiento es el tipoco con los heroes recorriendo el mundo y entrando en una batalla pro turnos cada vez que se encuentran un enemigo al estilo de los antiguos final fantasy.
En cuanto al nivel de dificultad, no es un paseo, pero en mi opinion esta bastante bien ajustado. No vas a ganar todas las batallas a la primera pero de momento tampoco he encontrado ninguna que se superase en unos pocos intentos.

Por ultimo, los  contras, que son los tipicos de los juegos de RPGmaker. Graficos normales, nada esplendidos (en mi opinion estan bien para el tipo de juego).

author: {'steamid': '76561197961745037', 'num_games_owned': 1872, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1449907975}
review:
Wow! 
I can't believe it... a QUALITY RPGMaker game?! 
It is hard to believe, but I think I've finally found it! I've probably played...dozens... of RPGMaker titles on steam and this is the first time I've actually felt like somebody put some real time, effort and HEART into their RPGMaker game.

Pros-
-The premise is amazing; seriously original, and the setting is a new twist on old hat. Good story. Sadly... I don't usually have the patience for JRPGs... but I really want to find out where they take the story! This one might sway me to finish it once I get Fallout 4 out of the way...
-Art and assets are nicely done
-No typos or bad spelling, grammar, etc!!! Sadly, this issue must be addressed in the RPGMaker arena. Anyway, this game clears the bar!
-Funny dialog, not corny crap like others of this ilk. Self-aware dialog, but used sparingly, so it doesn't break the 4th wall and get silly.
-Characters are actually interesting! *SPOILERS* but you get a ghost friend, a lady with multiple personalities and you get to control an enemy character. It kind of has a Chrono Cross feel to it, in that way.

Cons-
-I wish the combat were a little quicker. I know you can remove the combat animations in the options, which would help a little, but it just feels like it drags a little in the early part of the game when you fight 1 v 3 enemies and they all take a second to hit... and then you have to set your cursor over again
-Some aspects of the game could use a little better explaining, like the 'user level' or whatever it was called. The bonus given when beating an area. Not sure I understand the different levels and how its calculated. Also, the item and armor upgrading is a little mysterious and cumbersome since you can't be currently wearing the item you wish to upgrade (Update: they fixed this upgrading nusance)

*Disclaimers*
I played on Easy mode in order to get as far as possible in a limited time (it is the holidays, after all), so I can't comment on the "standard" difficulty, and;
I received a free copy of this game in exchange for my honest review.

Bottom line: I'll admit, JRPGs aren't really my bag anymore, I was really into them about a decade ago, but this one really has some fresh ideas for the genre. Seriously though, this is one of the best RPGMaker JRPGs I've ever played, it's totally worth it for the full price of $3, and if its on sale, definitely give it a go for the current sale price of a buck and change.

review:
This game manages to wrap all of the things I look for in traditional JRPGs into one small package.  It's interesting seeing how it makes you strategize, since you play as the NPCs instead of the heroes.  I think that this actually does a better job of representing the ideal JRPG gameplay than many JRPGs, since you can't just be a super-powered hero and smash everything without a thought.

If you want the joys of playing a JRPG without wanting to commit to starting another epic journey, or if you're intrigued by the reversed plot of playing NPCs, then this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151882830', 'num_games_owned': 3222, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1450062537}
review:
Compared to their last game Epic Quest of the 4 Crystals(which was also good), RosePortal Games have made some major improvements in their new game Oh! RPG. 

First thing I have to say is that the setting of this game is much darker than the previous, but the story is much more engaging as well and characters are more compeling and interesting, at least to me. I won't get into any spoilers here but let's just say that our main character is not our usual "hero" and his inner struggle is what makes this game so different.
Once you start playing this game you won't be able to stop (At least I barely took my hands of my laptop).
And not only because of the story, but also because the maps and the world inside the game is much bigger, so it might take a while to finish a chapter or a part of the story, since there are so many areas to explore and secrets to uncover.

The combat system has also been improved, however enemies are much harder to beat from start, on normal mode, so you will have to invest in crafting and upgrading potions, weapons and armor, and develop fighting strategies. (Luckily there is a button to try the fight again if you die)
That being said the crafting system has been majorly improved as well.

Lastly but not least important the artwork in Oh! Rpg, looks even better than in RosePortal's previous games. It looks so very well designed, when it comes to both the characters and enemies. Even the whole world looks more realistic and 3d like compared to other rpg makers.

Overall I think that this is one of the better rpg maker games made by now and at this price it is a definite must buy! :D
For the time I played [b]10/10 [/b]

I will keep playing the game, as the story got me really intrigued and I can't wait to see what happens next. The review will be further updated and expanded as I play more of the game.

review:
El juego para lo que cuesta no está nada mal, cumple su función de entrenter al mismo tiempo que trata de ser original.

El juego está dividido por capitulos. En cada capitulos manejas un personaje diferente que se ve de alguna manera afectado por los heroes de la historia.

Este personaje es el único que manejas y en las batallas lo máximo que puedes hacer es hacer una llamada a dichos heroes para que te echen una mano con alguno de sus poderosos ataques.

Pros:
-El apartado artistico está bastante bien
-Cambia un poco la dinámica de otros RPG
-Es entretenido
-Vas probando diferentes personajes con diferentes situaciones en cada capitulo. Además en cada uno hay alguna mecánica nueva
-Es barato
-Tienes un limite de objeto por capitulos, por lo que no puedes ir desperdiciando por ahí los materiales y tienes que pensar un poco cuando sale rentable o no usarlo

Contras:
-No es muy largo
-Si quieres repetir episodios para mejorar tu ranking puede ser un poco tedioso volver a tragarse todas las "cinemáticas"
-Como todo el rato cambias de personajes y de items que usa tienes que estar constantemente leyendo y memorizando que es que
-Al comienzo, hasta que entiendes como funciona el juego, puede ser un poco frustrante llevar un solo personaje (que empiezan siendo bastante malillos)
-Estás obligado a explorar para encontrar las armas para tu personaje, en caso de no hacerlo puede ser bastante costoso matar los enemigos
-El sistema de pociones, no está mal del todo, pero tienes que mejorar tus propias pociones con materiales que consigues, para mejorar tus pociones y hacerlas más eficientes. Las pociones tienen que mejorarse si o si, de lo contrario los items de mejoras son inutiles y la poción sin upgradear tambien. La idea es interesante, pero en medio de una batalla si se te ha olvidado upgradearlas y te queda poca vida puedes darte por jodid*


Como nota final le pondría un 6/10. No es maravilla de juego pero al menos es original y es muy barato, se le puede dar una oportundidad

author: {'steamid': '76561198004434755', 'num_games_owned': 1003, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1449804220}
review:
OH! RPG! is an intriguing role-playing game created by RosePortal Games, a developer you might know from their previous game, Epic Quest of the 4 Crystals. Built with RPGMaker MV, it is a tribute to both the software and the genre as a whole, but also an enjoyable game in its own right. It stands out by telling a story of a world where the heroes were unable to defeat the evil that threatened it, and so humanity is forced to prepare for their inevitable demise. Interestingly, the playable cast consists not of the heroes themselves, but instead various characters that would simply be NPCs in other games, such as a jester or an old lady. The heroes interact with these characters in different ways throughout the story, sometimes receiving help from them and other times providing assistance as they attend to their own desires. While the game is not particularly long, the world is developed so that you still get the feeling of a place that has been adventured through, with already-looted chests and allusions to unseen events. All of this results in a surprisingly compelling setting that, though very recognizable to anyone who has played a classic RPG before, still manages to feel novel.

The gameplay of OH! RPG! provides an appeal of its own as well. While it uses a basic RPG combat system, complexity comes from the fact that you have limited resources to work with and battles are generally not in your favor. For the most part, you control only a single character at a time and have to plan your fights around that point. Additionally, there is notable importance placed on the "Hero Call" system, which lets you summon the heroes to complement your own actions. Since they take a few turns to show up and the number of times you can use them is sometimes limited, correctly timing these calls (as well as choosing the correct ability for the hero to use) can be crucial to your success. At the end of each chapter, you are scored based on your performance, which unlocks useful bonuses. There are also a number of fun sidequests and secrets to be found which give the game more longevity.

Admittedly, OH! RPG! is not without its issues. The difficulty of the battles can be overwhelming at times if you slip up, some areas are overly labyrinthine, and the puzzles are occasionally confusing. However, these can also be seen as positives for a player who likes a decent challenge, and the game is certainly fair about it - you can save anywhere and lower the difficulty level if you want, and you don't have to worry about random encounters. All in all, I find this game easy to recommend to anyone who likes RPGs and is in the mood to try something that is both a little different and a little familiar.

NOTE: I am required by Valve to state that I received a free key for this game from the developer for the purpose of beta testing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012804587', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1449884721}
review:
Firstly, I think it as a good thing that I had the chance to play the game before its release. But regardless of anything, I will still review it as any other game I play. So:

OH! RPG is one of the many RPGs out there made in the RPG Makers series. Thus, it gets the RPG potential of such a game. But it takes another route instead of the standard routine RPGs take. It takes a good question like : "What if the Hero Party managed to reach the final Boss - The Great Demon Lord or just The Dark Lord of the game - but instead of winning they ended up losing?" and without commensing with all their adventure at all or spawning a GAME OVER screen, it plays around minor characters and sometimes enemies who change sides to help or who are in need of help and that is what we get to control! To me that is a magnificent mechanic. But it is not all about the game yet.

The game itself needs caution in every way possible. Whatever you do, do it quickly and think about it. The game is played in missions with ratings which is also a nice touch. The controversial Hero Support that may or may not exist or even break down to be just a minor assist once is a good challenge for any player. Since we got around here and in order for this not to go too lengthy let me start listing the Pros and the Cons.

Pros (+)
+ A prototype and inovative idea.
+ Nice music.
+ Nice sprites.
+ Smart made skills.
+ Equipment/Item Upgrades.
+ It is an RPG - which for me is more than good enough as a +.
+ Its side quests are tricky to complete.
+ It needs you to use your brain far more than you think you need.
+ Your choice is everything in order to avoid GAME OVER.

Cons (-)
- A player not familiar with RPGs will not enjoy the game quickly enough.
- Brutish players will have to think. ( :P )
- If you make a choice which at the time seems right but is wrong in the end, you are pretty much screwed. (Yes, especially in the Old Lady one)
- If you do not manage your saves right, it might be a GAME OVER as well.

Overall
It is an excellent game following a much smarter route rather than blindly going into an RPG. It gives a nice feeling off by letting the player follow storylines besides the main one. And it requires a lot more attention to details so it is a lot more challenging. If I had to rate it from 0 - 100 then I'd give it a 90 out of 100. The last 10% making it a MUST HAVE would be if it had all the regular storyline with the heros and then after the end of the main story giving you this set of missions. Making a double storyline and giving you the excitement of both playing the heroes and then everyone after they fail. How awesome would that be? :P

review:
Disclaimer: I received a key from the developer in order to test/leave feedback on this game. I have not been compelled to leave positive feedback and have judged this game by my own standards.


OH! RPG! is a game that starts where other games would usually end- with the heroic party being defeated by the final boss. This is usually where you'd enjoy a Bad End with credits or at least reload and try again- but these heroes just have to live with it and accept the help of an unlikely source... but you're the unlikely source and the heroes are mechanically just sporadic 'summons' who might be around to help you help them out- or once you switch perspectives, they're just around while you're doing something important to your new character. You get to play as what would normally be NPCs, to sum it up, in an RPG universe where the world is pretty much coming to an end. Surprisingly, it's less dour than that sounds like it should be.
I write this review having completed the first section of the game and having dug into the second section. Take note that even on Easy Mode, I find that I can't just sleepwalk my way through the game. It's not impossible-hard, but I would say that you probably should have some sort of background in turn-based RPGs because the game doesn't hand-hold much past the first section. As far as I can tell, due to the episodic nature of the sections of the game, you can't and won't be level-grinding and you have to deal with whatever items you can find, as well as deciding what items to improve with the crafting items you find along the way. 
Overall, I would recommend the game to anyone who likes turn-based RPGs and is interested by the quirk of the game. Even though the sections seem like they will be fairly short and will probably continue to be- I liked playing the game from the differing perspectives and had at least some small interest even in the first character I played as.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972281569', 'num_games_owned': 2950, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1450016546}
review:
Oh! RPG! is the new game of RosePortal Games. It's an 16-bit JRPG  where you're going to play as NPC and help heroes along the way to return at home after their ludicrous failure against a big demon.

This is a new twist of the story and you can play it from another perspective. 

The main character is easy to control using five keys and mouse, or you could you only use mouse to perform all actions. 

Graphics are color full and have well detailed Japanese cartoon style.

There are a variety of well performed musics and sounds are quite normal.

There is a lot of humor in dialogs, and all characters have their personality well defined.

Combat system has multiple options but is a little different. You're alone and you fight using your own powers and potions but you can also invoke the power of the heroes and their special skills. They arrive in a number of turns so you must plan their appearance and survive until then. The hero will be different for each battle depending on where they are in the story.

During the game you can collect material to upgrade the power/efficiency of your weapons, armor and potions. The game has little crafting menu to customize them as you want. All objects are their statistics detailed.

At the first moment the game introduces you in all the aspects using some hints and tips.

The map is not complex but i miss the little map of the area in the corner of the screen that appeared in its previous game. 

I'm playing the first chapter as a little goblin, but the game has seven more and as the developers say each chapter has a 
different atmosphere, game play and a new character to play with.

The game has achievements and trading cards.

It's a good choice if you like Japanese style role games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034118741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1450382601}
review:
OH! RPG! is a turn-based RPG made by developer RosePortal Games in RPG Maker MV.

The game starts right where a typical RPG game would end, at the epic battle featuring the 
heroes versus the final boss. The player is then presented with a very interesting premise; this time the heroes are defeated and forced to run away knowing that the world will end because of their failure.

In this game the player does not play as the heroes themselves, but as the various NPC that they encounter throughout their shameful journey back home. The game is composed of eight chapters, each of them starred by a different character and with a different style. 

Scenarios are colourful, varied and well designed, and the music adapts well to the situations presented. 

As for the gameplay, the game is basically a standard old-school RPG game, with turn-based battles, weapons and armor the player can find and equip and usable items such as healing potions.

Even though the heroes will not always be present in the party,  providing they are nearby the controllable character can use their skills in battle... The player must keep in mind, however, that these special attacks take some turns to activate, and that using them too much will result in a lower User rank at the end of the chapter. 

The game presents an interesting crafting system that allows for items and equipment to be greatly upgraded directly through the menu. 

All in all, the game is fun and entertaining, and I believe it to be worth playing. I would recommend it to fans of old-school RPG games and to anyone that finds the game's premise intriguing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178653713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1452080682}
review:
There you are. The final boss in the adventure, and the destiny of the realm rests in your ability to vanquish him. But unfortunately you fail and the world is going to get destroyed. Now you have to escape him and make it in time to watch the end of the world with your loved ones.

That´s the starting point of this adventure. You have to help the jer.. heores get back to their homes and loved ones using the help of NPCs, quite different ones depending on the stage you are in. Some of them include a goblin, an old lady or a nun, to name a few.

These stages have a strong strategy component. Your characters start with a predetermined level and have to beat 
mostly all enemies during the stage, along with the smart use of the Hero calls during fights, to be able to get a chance to finish the stage boss and get a good rank (if you aren´t playing on easy mode, that is).

Which brings us to the User Ranks. This feature activates at the end of the stage and gives you a certain amount of points depending on difficulty, exp and gold earned. These ranks unlock certain helps and extras that makes the game easier and replayable, like the "don Miguel" and Mapping Tools, that makes you revisit stages to find secrets that you couldn´t unlock the first time you played those stages.

All in all, a great, funny game that may be not that long (it´s, in words of the developers, 4 hours long), but with a great replay value. By the time i´m writing this review, i´ve clocked 18 hours and i´ve yet to unlock all the little secrets this game has to offer. Very recommended.
